body:
Here is the crashes.

I will try to increase the size of StackMin.

But why little-endian is fine?

发件人: Ian Lance Taylor [mailto:notifications@github.com]
发送时间: 2016年3月1日 9:30
收件人: golang/go
抄送: Zhangyichao (AB)
主题: Re: [go] libgo crashes on arm64 (#14567)


The stack trace suggests memory corruption.

The most likely cause of memory corruption is a stack overrun.

You could try increasing the size of StackMin in libgo/runtime/proc.c.

Yes, when switching between goroutines, the scheduler will save and restore registers. This is implemented by calling the C library routines getcontext and setcontext.

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub<https://github.com/golang/go/issues/14567#issuecomment-190481918>.
